CaseAppointments.InquestNarrativeConclusion: Narrative - Keith Mann died on the 20 May 2025 at Luton University Hospital, Lewsey Road in Luton. He died from sepsis due to an infected sacral pressure ulcer which occurred following a long lie which occurred at his home on the 23 March 2025 where he was located and unable to get himself up from the toilet. He was subsequently admitted to hospital where despite treatment and tissue viability input his condition deteriorated and he subsequently developed sepsis.

Her medical cause of death was hypothermia on a background of alcohol intoxication. There was no evidence of suspicious circumstances /third party involvement

DeceasedAddress.FullAddress: 9 St. Loyes Street, Bedford, Bedfordshire, MK401HG

CaseAppointments.InquestNarrativeConclusion: It is believed that the failure to call OSCAR 1 after the telephone cord incident directly impacted Steven and this did not allow for a further ACCT review to take place and enable the removal of ligature material to be assessed, support to be put in place, observations to be increased and a full risk assessment to be carried out. Items could have been removed to prevent further self harm or suicide attempts by Steven had this been facilitated by contacting OSCAR1. It is unclear from the evidence given whether Steven would have been placed on constant observations as this is assessed on a case by case basis. It would appear from the earlier incident on 25th March 2023 that Steven's mental health was deteriorating and in fact he was looking for an opportunity to hurt himself or end his life. There is no evidence available to suggest whether the metal observation panel was broken prior to 25th March 2023. It is the belief of the jury that the checks seen in the CCTV were not carried out to the proper standard and it is the belief that there was a failure to inform the healthcare team of the telephone ligature attempt.

CaseAppointments.InquestNarrativeConclusion: Narrative - Keith Mann died on the 20 May 2025 at Luton University Hospital, Lewsey Road in Luton. He died from sepsis due to an infected sacral pressure ulcer which occurred following a long lie which occurred at his home on the 23 March 2025 where he was located and unable to get himself up from the toilet. He was subsequently admitted to hospital where despite treatment and tissue viability input his condition deteriorated and he subsequently developed sepsis.
